item.description: 3d Brush and Rasterization # Is the process of taking an image, described in a vector graphics format and converting it into a series of pixels, dots, or almost any shape. When these shapes are together, they will form the original image. Vector graphics are a set of mathematical statements which place lines shapes in a 3d or 2d enviroment, being generally a group of mathematical curves, these are great for printing or image manipulation, even when enlarger they retain detail and quality, while raster graphics uses bitmaps to store information, this can limit the quality depending on resolution and file size.

Taller 2 # When a low-quality image is zoomed in or processed, the edges tend to become jagged or staggered. To solve this problem, we must apply smoothing to the figure. The process is carried out by generating a subdivision of the original pixels of the image. image in a greater number of pixels, to perform a smoothing of the edges with the use of barycentric coordinates, triangles are calculated on the original image.
